isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER DIAGNOSTICS AND SERVICE - REMOVE AND INSTALL - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400, 9900 MODELS

svcsubproc.title: January 1989 to January 1991 - Speedometer/Tachometer Gauges, Remove

important.para: Turn switch key to OFF position before removing or installing gauges.

note.para:
Before replacing speedometer or tachometer gauges, refer to CLUSTER FAILURE DIAGNOSIS
to verify gauge(s) need replacing.

step1.para: Remove the access panel next to the gauge being removed. These are the gauge cluster panels to the right and left of the speedo/tach gauge panel ( Figure 7 and Figure 8).

figure.caption: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400, 9900 Models Right Gauge Cluster Panel, January 1989 to January 1991
5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400, 9900 Models Left Gauge Cluster Panel, January 1989 to January 1991

step1.para: Place hand through gauge cluster opening to remove special locking wing nuts from rear of gauge mounting clamp ( Figure 7 and Figure 8, Item 6).

note.para: These are special locking wing nuts and should not be replaced with plain wing nuts.

step1.para: Remove speedometer and/or tachometer from instrument panel opening.
Disconnect gauge connector(s) from wiring harness and pull light bulb sockets out of the back of each gauge ( Figure 9).

figure.caption: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400, 9900 Models Speedometer Connections and Mounting, January 1989 to January 1991

svcsubproc.title: January 1989 to January 1991 - Speedometer/Tachometer Gauges, Install

step1.para: Insert speedo/tach harness connector(s) through openings in the instrument panel and connect to the gauge(s).
Insert gauge illumination light bulb sockets into gauge housing(s).

note.para: Insert high beam indicator light #53 into center opening of the speedometer housing.

step1.para: Align tab on the gauge housing with slot in opening and position into instrument panel.
Install gauge mounting clamp with special locking wing nuts.

note.para: Test high beam indicator and illumination lights for operation prior to installing the access panel mounting screws.

step1.para: Attach connector(s) to gauge cluster and position access panel into instrument panel.
Attach bezel to gauge cluster and secure with four screws.
Test lights and test speedo/tach gauges on road or dynamometer after installation.

svcsubproc.title: January 1991 thru January 1994 - Speedometer/Tachometer Cluster, Remove

important.para: Turn switch key to OFF position before removing or installing unit.

note.para:
Before replacing a speedometer/tachometer gauge cluster, refer to CLUSTER FAILURE DIAGNOSIS
to verify cluster needs replacing.

step1.para: Remove screws securing speedometer/tachometer cluster to instrument panel. Tilt top of unit toward steering wheel ( Figure 10).

figure.caption: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400, 9900 Models Speedometer/Tachometer Unit, January 1991 thru May 1994

step1.para: Disconnect speedometer/tachometer cluster from vehicle instrument panel harness and pull the four illumination lights and one high beam indicator light out of the back of the housing ( Figure 11).

figure.caption: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400, 9900 Models Speedometer/Tachometer Cluster Connections, January 1991 thru May 1994

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. J1708 SERIAL DATA LINK CONNECTOR (RED AND BLUE WIRES)
3. TACHOMETER SENSOR CONNECTOR (VIOLET AND BROWN WIRES)
4. INSTRUMENT PANEL HARNESS TACHOMETER CONNECTOR (HAS SENSOR LEADS (2) AND UNUSED B+ AND GROUND CIRCUIT)
5. B+ VOLTAGE, GROUND AND SPEEDOMETER SENSOR CONNECTOR (4 WIRES)
6. INSTRUMENT PANEL B+ VOLTAGE, GROUND AND SPEEDOMETER SENSOR CONNECTOR

step1.para: Remove speedometer/tachometer cluster from instrument panel.

svcsubproc.title: January 1991 thru January 1994 - Speedometer/Tachometer Cluster, Install

step1.para: Position speedometer/tachometer cluster behind steering wheel, tilted forward ( Figure 10).
Install four gauge illuminating lights and one high beam indicator light into back of housing ( Figure 11).
Connect speedo/tach cluster harness connectors to the vehicle harness connectors ( Figure 11).

note.para: Test high-beam and cluster illumination light operation before installing mounting screws mentioned in next step.

step1.para: Position unit into instrument panel and install mounting screws. Test speedometer/tachometer unit functions and lights on road test or on dynamometer when installation is complete.

svcsubproc.title: January 1991 thru January 1994 - Speedometer/Tachometer Gauges, Remove
svcsubproc.para: The speedometer/tachometer cluster consists of four serviceable (replaceable) components: speedometer, tachometer, odometer and cluster housing which includes the printed circuit board. To disassemble the unit to access the components:

step1.para: Remove six screws ( Figure 12), two on top and bottom and one on each end.

figure.caption: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400, 9900 Models Speedometer and Tachometer Gauges, January 1991 thru May 1994

step1.para: Lift off the face plate to access the three meters.
The speedometer and tachometer each mount on four pins. To remove either gauge, grip the edges of the gauge face plate and lift directly away from the housing.
To remove the odometer, first remove the speedometer gauge. Disconnect the odometer from the printed circuit at connector J1. Remove two screws from back of cluster that retain the odometer and clip.

svcsubproc.title: January 1991 thru January 1994 - Speedometer/Tachometer Gauges, Install

step1.para: Position the odometer in the housing and install and tighten the two mounting screws. Connect the odometer lead to the J1 pins.

The speedo/tach gauges are plug-in type gauges. To install, grasp the gauge by the edge of the dial face. Align the four gauge pins to the circuit board terminal openings and gently push into place. The gauge case is non-conductive material so that if power were applied, the case will not short out the pins.
Position housing face plate and insert the six screws and tighten.

svcsubproc.title: June 1994 and Later - Speedometer/Tachometer Module, Remove

important.para: Turn switch key to OFF position before removing or installing unit.

note.para:
Before replacing a speedometer/tachometer gauge cluster, refer to CLUSTER FAILURE DIAGNOSIS
to verify cluster needs replacing.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to ( Figure 13) for the following removal procedure.

figure.caption: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400, 9900 Models Speedometer/Tachometer Module, June 1994 and Later

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. LOCATION FOR DIGITAL OR MECHANICAL ODOMETER
5. MODULE COVER RETAINING SCREWS (SIX - TWO TOP AND BOTTOM, AND ONE ON EACH SIDE)

step1.para: Remove four screws securing speedometer/tachometer cluster to instrument panel.
Remove the module from the instrument panel far enough to disconnect the two 20-terminal module connectors (421, white and 422, yellow).
Remove speedometer/tachometer cluster from instrument panel.

svcsubproc.title: June 1994 and Later - Speedometer/Tachometer Module, Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to ( Figure 13) for the following installation procedure.

step1.para: Position the speedo/tach module by the instrument panel opening.
Connect the two 20-pin terminal connectors (421, white and 422, yellow) to the back of the module.
Place speedo/tach module in opening and install the four screws securing the module to the instrument panel.

svcsubproc.title: June 1994 and Later - Speedometer/Tachometer Gauges, Remove

step1.para: With the module removed from the instrument panel, remove six face plate retaining screws (two on the top and bottom and one on each side).
Remove the face plate from the housing to access the gauges.
The speedometer and tachometer each mount on four pins. To remove either gauge, grip the edges of the gauge face plate and lift directly away from the housing.

svcsubproc.title: June 1994 and Later - Speedometer/Tachometer Gauges, Install

step1.para: The speedo/tach gauges are plug-in type gauges. To install, grasp the edge of the gauge face plate and align the gauge pins with the pin terminals on the circuit board and push straight in.
Assemble the face plate panel to the module housing.
Install six face plate panel mounting screws (2 on the top and bottom and 1 on each side).

svcsubproc.title: June 1994 and Later - Mechanical Odometer, Remove

step1.para: With the speedometer gauge removed, remove the three mounting screws from the odometer.
Unplug the J3 connector (marked J3 on circuit board) and remove odometer.

svcsubproc.title: June 1994 and Later - Mechanical Odometer, Install

step1.para: Route the odometer wiring connector through the circuit board and plug it into the J3 terminal on the back of the circuit board.
Position the odometer and install the three mounting screws. Check and adjust alignment of the odometer to the opening in the speedometer gauge, before final tightening of the screws.
Grasp the edge of the speedometer gauge face plate and align the gauge pins with the pin terminals on the circuit board and push straight in.
Check final alignment of odometer with opening in speedometer.

svcsubproc.title: June 1994 and Later - Digital Odometer/Hourmeter, Remove

note.para: The main memory of the circuit board stores the odometer/hourmeter information. When a new digital unit is installed, it will display the previous miles and hours data of the vehicle.

step1.para: With the speedometer gauge removed, remove four mounting screws from the stand-offs which separate the odometer from the main circuit board.
Disconnect digital odometer connector from the circuit board and remove the odometer.

svcsubproc.title: June 1994 and Later - Digital Odometer/Hourmeter, Install

step1.para: Connect the digital odometer connector to the circuit board terminal.
Position the odometer on the four mounting stand-offs and install and tighten four mounting screws.
